job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates complex business needs into structured requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure testable, developer-ready outputs. Requires 4+ years of experience in SaaS or scalable systems with strong analytical and communication skills.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Translates business needs into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and traceability across development. Collaborates with stakeholders to align requirements with technical execution.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead our cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect, maintain, and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build, operate, and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.
  • Strong expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking knowledge: LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers.
  • Security frameworks: OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks.
  • Monitoring tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM.
  • Scripting skills: Python, Bash, Shell.
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Diploma/B.Tech/MCA in IT, CS, or MCA.
  • SOC operations experience or SIEM/SOAR tool exposure.
  • Certifications: AWS Security/DevOps Engineer – Professional, CKS, CEH, CompTIA Security+.

Benefits

  • Growth-driven environment with leadership and innovation opportunities.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead secure cloud infrastructure and DevSecOps practices with 4-8 years of experience in AWS, Terraform, and Ansible.

job_description:
About the Company

Maple Tech Space (MTS) is a Canadian IT consultancy firm established in 2020, with headquarters in Ontario and offshore offices in Kerala, India. Specializing in IT consulting, digital marketing, app development, and web services, MTS has launched three successful products in the Canadian market, serving over 1,000 clients. AgentRoof, a fast-growing PropTech division, empowers real estate professionals in Canada and the US with websites, CRM, lead generation, and social media marketing solutions.

Role & Responsibilities

As a Senior Business Development Manager, you will: - Sales Ownership & Strategy: Drive individual and team sales performance across US/Canada markets, ensuring consistent achievement of monthly and quarterly targets. - Cold Calling & Prospecting: Oversee outbound calling strategies; guide the team to maintain 60–80 outbound calls per day per rep while personally engaging in high-value prospecting. - Pitching & Presentations: Deliver and standardize impactful product pitches (websites, CRM, marketing services) and train the team on value-based selling. - Demo Management: Supervise scheduling, conducting, and closing of demos; lead complex demos and assist the team in deal closures. - Lead Conversion: Drive high lead-to-client conversion rates; ensure minimum monthly sign-up targets are met at both individual and team levels. - Client Retention: Build and manage key client relationships, drive upsell/cross-sell initiatives, and ensure renewals and long-term retention. - Team Management & Training: Recruit, onboard, train, mentor, and manage a team of Business Development Managers; conduct regular coaching, call reviews, and performance feedback sessions. - Performance Tracking: Set KPIs, monitor daily activities (calls, demos, conversions), and implement corrective actions to improve team performance. - CRM Management: Ensure accurate CRM usage, pipeline hygiene, activity tracking, and consistent follow-ups across the team. - Market Insights: Gather customer objections, competitor intelligence, and market trends; share insights with leadership to improve sales strategies and product offerings.

Requirements

  • Experience: 4–6+ years in outbound sales/business development for US/Canada clients, with 1–2 years in a team lead or managerial role (SaaS or Real Estate experience preferred).
  • Skills: Strong expertise in cold calling, product pitching, negotiation, deal closure, and sales coaching.
  • Language Proficiency: English – Mandatory (excellent spoken & written communication). Knowledge of Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, or other regional languages is a plus.
  • Personality: Highly driven, persuasive, energetic leader with strong influencing and decision-making abilities.
  • Performance: Proven track record of consistently achieving or exceeding individual and team sales targets.
  • Tech-Savvy: Hands-on experience with CRM tools, lead management systems, reporting dashboards, and virtual demo platforms (Zoom/Meet).
  • Flexibility: Willingness to work night shifts aligned with North American time zones.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary + attractive performance-based incentives.
  • Opportunity to work with a high-growth PropTech brand in Canada/US markets.
  • Fast career progression for high performers.
  • Work-from-home flexibility with international exposure.
  • Dynamic and young team culture.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume at careers@mapletechspace.com.

Location: Work from Home (Night Shift: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM IST) Industry: Real Estate Tech (Websites, CRM, Lead Generation & Marketing Services)
summary: Lead a sales team to drive revenue growth for a PropTech company, focusing on US/Canada markets with expertise in cold calling, CRM, and sales strategy.

job_description:
Facilities Manager

About the Job

As a specialist in electronics and software for the past 20 years, in-tech is a dynamic, fast-growing engineering company headquartered in Munich, Germany, employing around 2,350 employees globally across 20 project locations in 8 countries. Now a 100% subsidiary of Infosys Ltd since 2024, our India locations blend Indian and European work cultures to foster a collaborative, team-oriented environment. With expansion across Kerala and other Indian states, we seek a Facilities Manager to oversee high-quality engineering facilities across a multi-site portfolio.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Lead hands-on management of multiple sites, ensuring facilities, equipment, and grounds meet high standards.
  • Conduct regular inspections to identify maintenance needs, safety risks, and improvement opportunities.
  • Manage planned preventative maintenance (PPM) and reactive repairs efficiently.
  • Ensure compliance with Indian legislation (Health & Safety, Fire Safety, environmental regulations).
  • Collaborate with site managers to prioritize operational needs.
  • Build and maintain relationships with external contractors, vendors, and service providers.
  • Lead projects like refurbishments, relocations, and IT infrastructure upgrades.
  • Maintain accurate records for compliance, certifications, and inspections.
  • Coordinate emergency procedures (fire safety, incident reporting, business continuity).
  • Monitor and manage facilities budgets, providing forecasts to leadership.
  • Support sustainability initiatives and optimize utility usage for cost and energy savings.
  • Collaborate with finance teams to prepare and review facility budgets.

Requirements

  • 8+ years of hands-on facilities management experience in a multi-site environment.
  • Proven track record in delivering new facility projects from start to finish.
  • Experience managing external vendors and contractors.
  • Strong knowledge of health & safety and building compliance.
  • Commercial awareness with a solutions-focused approach.
  • Confident leader capable of developing and managing teams.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft tools (Excel, Office suite).
  • Ability to thrive in fast-paced environments with tight deadlines.
  • First-rate business-level English and communication skills.
  • Team-oriented, open-minded, and proactive personality.

Apply with us

If you align with our values and career goals, apply at https://in-tech.com/en/carrers/jobs/facilities-manager-1911 or email your resume to india.talent@in-tech.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer

in-tech is committed to equal employment opportunity, regardless of age, race, gender, disability, or other protected categories.

About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

LTS is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. We are proud to be trusted by leading global organizations, supporting them in building sustainable, people-centric transformation at scale.

With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work. That belief shapes our products, our culture, and how we work together.

Location: Technopark Phase1, Trivandrum

Role Overview

We are seeking a skilled Software Engineer - React.js with 2+ years of experience to join our dynamic development team. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in React.js and Next.js. You will be responsible for building and optimizing user-facing applications while collaborating with backend developers, designers, and other stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop, optimize, and maintain scalable React.js applications.
  • Work with Next.js for server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation (SSG), and API routes.
  • Implement state management solutions using Redux, Zustand, or Context API.

  • Integrate RESTful and GraphQL APIs into React applications.
  • Utilize modern UI frameworks like Tailwind CSS, Material-UI (MUI), ShadCN UI, and Chakra UI for responsive design.
  • Write reusable components and maintainable code with best practices.
  • Collaborate with backend teams to define API requirements and optimize frontend-backend communication.
  • Work with build tools like Webpack, Vite, and Babel for application bundling and optimization.
  • Implement authentication and authorization using JWT, OAuth, Firebase, or NextAuth.js.
  • Conduct code reviews, write unit tests (Jest, React Testing Library), and ensure high code quality.
  • Stay up to date with the latest trends in React ecosystem and frontend development.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and enhance existing code to improve application performance.

Preferred Skills:

  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript.
  • Expertise in React.js and Next.js.
  • Experience with state management libraries: Redux (Redux Toolkit), Zustand, Context API.
  • Familiarity with CSS frameworks: Tailwind CSS, Material-UI (MUI), Chakra UI.
  • Experience integrating APIs (REST, GraphQL).
  • Knowledge of authentication and authorization (OAuth, Firebase, NextAuth.js).
  • Proficiency in build tools like Webpack, Vite, Babel.
  • Testing experience with Jest, React Testing Library.
  • Version control using Git and GitHub/GitLab.
  • Understanding of performance optimization and debugging in React applications.

Good to Have:

  • Experience with serverless functions (AWS, Vercel, Netlify).
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines for automated deployments.
  • Basic knowledge of Node.js and backend integration.
  • Hands-on experience with React Query or SWR for data fetching.

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations such as Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and other global leaders—helping them improve how they operate, lead, and grow.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Our platforms and processes are backed by internationally recognized ISO certifications, reflecting our strong commitment to quality, data security, and operational reliability.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we don’t just deliver solutions—we build long-term relationships. Together, we create a strong, sustainable future for our people, our clients, and our organization. From continuous learning and career development opportunities to meaningful ownership in your work, we support you at every stage of your journey. Our people benefit from a supportive work environment, competitive benefits, and a culture that values balance, trust, and long-term success.

At LTS, your growth is our growth—and when our people succeed, everything we build becomes stronger.

job_description:
About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

LTS is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company, headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. We are proud to be trusted by leading global organizations, supporting them in building sustainable, people-centric transformation at scale.

With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work. That belief shapes our products, our culture, and how we work together.

Location: Technopark Phase1, Trivandrum

Role Overview

The Pre-Sales Demo Executive is responsible for delivering a best-in-class demo and trial experience across the company’s SaaS portfolio. This role owns the end-to-end demo readiness lifecycle from environments, data, and scenarios to leadership briefings and meeting preparedness, ensuring that Sales, Pre-Sales, and Senior Leadership consistently present a compelling, confident, and professional product narrative to prospective customers.

This is a senior individual contributor role with high visibility and influence, requiring strong ownership, attention to detail, and the ability to proactively drive standards across multiple teams.

Experience: 1-3 Years

Key Responsibilities

  1. Demo Environment Ownership
  2. Own and manage all demo environments across web and mobile platforms
  3. Ensure systems are stable, current, and demo-ready at all times
  4. Coordinate with Engineering and IT for deployments, updates, fixes, and environment health

  5. Act as a super user with full system privileges and deep functional understanding

  6. Demo Scenarios & Data Excellence

  7. Design, create, and maintain multiple demo scenarios per product, including role-based and industry-specific scenarios
  8. Create realistic, high-quality demo datasets that clearly showcase product value
  9. Refresh and reset demo data to maintain consistency and reliability

  10. Ensure all demo data complies with GDPR and internal data governance standards

  11. Demo Flow Definition & Documentation

  12. Define and document the ideal demo flow for each product, user role, and scenario
  13. Maintain clear demo runbooks, scripts, and supporting guidance

  14. Continuously refine demo flows based on feedback from Sales, Pre-Sales, and Leadership

  15. Access & Credential Management

  16. Manage demo login credentials and access (manual process)
  17. Ensure credentials are secure, up to date, and readily available for internal use
  18. Coordinate access approvals with the Pre-Sales Leader

  19. Maintain clear documentation of demo users and permissions

  20. Sales, Pre-Sales & Leadership Enablement

  21. Ensure demo readiness 3–5 days ahead of scheduled meetings
  22. Support teams with demo confirmations, demo paths, and pre-meeting briefs
  23. Provide concise daily or weekly summaries of planned demos and priorities

  24. Attend key demos or leadership meetings where appropriate and value-adding

  25. Meeting Preparation & Collateral Readiness

  26. Ensure leadership and sales teams have the correct decks, tools, and demo environments
  27. Maintain a single source of truth for demo assets and supporting materials

  28. Work closely with Product and Marketing teams to ensure consistent messaging

  29. Standards, Governance & Continuous Improvement

  30. Establish and enforce a standard demo workflow across teams
  31. Act as the quality gatekeeper for demo and trial experiences
  32. Capture demo feedback and share insights with Product and Pre-Sales teams
  33. Support long-term evolution towards PMO or Product Operations functions

Preferred Skills

  • Experience in pre-sales, demo operations, product enablement, or SaaS operations roles
  • Strong understanding of SaaS platforms and demo environments
  • Ability to manage multiple systems and stakeholders
  • Excellent documentation and organisation skills
  • Confident communicator with senior leadership
  • Strong ownership mindset
  • Experience supporting enterprise or regulated customers
  • Familiarity with GDPR and data governance
  • Exposure to CRM or pre-sales workflows
  • Background suitable for PMO or delivery governance progression

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations such as Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and other global leaders—helping them improve how they operate, lead, and grow.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Our platforms and processes are backed by internationally recognised ISO certifications, reflecting our strong commitment to quality, data security, and operational reliability. This means you work in an environment built on high standards and trust.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we don’t just deliver solutions—we build long-term relationships. Together, we create a strong, sustainable future for our people, our clients, and our organization. From continuous learning and career development opportunities to meaningful ownership in your work, we support you at every stage of your journey. Our people benefit from a supportive work environment, competitive benefits, and a culture that values balance, trust, and long-term success.

At LTS, your growth is our growth—and when our people succeed, everything we build becomes stronger.

Application Instructions

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resume to careers@ltslean.com and include the following information in the email content: - Current CTC: - Expected CTC: - Notice Period: - Current Location: - Total Relevant Experience: - Willingness to work at office:
summary: Senior Pre-Sales Demo Executive role at LTS, managing SaaS demo environments, scenarios, and supporting sales teams with data governance and CRM workflows.

Location: Technopark Phase 3 Type: Full-Time Experience Level: 1-3 years Closing Date: 23, Jan 2026 Published: 12, Jan 2026

Role Overview

We seek a versatile Infrastructure Engineer to manage the full lifecycle of our technology stack. You will bridge physical hardware and cloud environments, ensuring on-premise systems (servers, networking, storage) are secure and performant while scaling cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP, Digital Ocean).

Key Responsibilities

1. Hardware & On-Premise Maintenance - Installation & Configuration: Rack, stack, cable, and configure servers, switches, firewalls, and UPS systems. - Hardware Lifecycle: Conduct audits, firmware updates, and replace components (RAM, drives, CPUs). - Data Center Management: Monitor power, cooling, and security in server rooms/colocation spaces. - Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve hardware failures with minimal downtime.

2. Cloud Infrastructure & Virtualization - Cloud Administration: Manage VPCs, EC2 instances, S3 buckets, and IAM roles. - Virtualization: Optimize VMware, Hyper-V, or KVM environments. - Cost Optimization: Monitor cloud spend and implement rightsizing strategies. - Hybrid Connectivity: Maintain Site-to-Site VPNs or Direct Connect/ExpressRoute links.

3. Monitoring, Security, & Support - System Health: Implement monitoring tools for uptime and performance. - Backups & DR: Execute backup strategies and Disaster Recovery drills. - Security Patching: Apply OS and firmware patches against vulnerabilities.

Preferred Skills

Technical Requirements: - Hardware: Dell PowerEdge, HP ProLiant, Cisco/Ubiquiti networking, RAID configurations. - Cloud Platforms: AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Digital Ocean. - Operating Systems: Advanced Linux (Ubuntu/CentOS) and Windows Server administration. - Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation. - Networking: TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLANs, Firewall management.

Soft Skills & Qualifications: - Bachelor's in Computer Science/IT or equivalent experience. - Certifications: CompTIA Server+, AWS SysOps Administrator, Azure Administrator (AZ-104), or CCNA. - Mindset: Safety-first for hardware, cloud-first for scalability. - Availability: On-call rotation and after-hours maintenance.

  14. Ensure compliance with customer data privacy and operational standards.

  15. Insights, Reporting & Stakeholder Management

  16. Create weekly, monthly, and quarterly quality dashboards for leadership review.
  17. Present trends on CX gaps, agent performance, and customer sentiment insights.
  18. Partner with Product, CS Ops, and Support teams to improve workflows and customer journey experience.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to diagnose behavioural, technical, and communication issues.
  • Experience running calibrations, RCAs, and process improvement initiatives.

Preferred Qualifications
